A few years ago I came across the package `ggiraph` by David Gohel.  It is a packag that allows `ggplot2` graphics to have some interactive elements by using `d3.js` and the general duct-tape-and-fairy-dust interactivity in R graphics that is `htmlWidgets`.  It is a wondeful package, and I am a big fan of the customization and quality that it affords.  I mean `ggplot2` alone brings people to R with quality of graphics, add high quality interactivity is just sprinkles.
